resources.string:

A widget that animates label on screen.
Display text selection actions such as Cut, Copy, and Paste for selected text.

Starting from Android 6.0 (API 23), apps can display text selection actions such as Cut, Copy, Paste in a contextual floating toolbar. 

In devices running Android 6.0 (API 23), the framework able to display the selection actions in either floating toolbar or action bar mode, while on devices running Android 5.1 (API 22) or lower, only the latter is supported. 

*Long click on any text to bring up the text selection actions.
A layout designed to block out an area on the screen.
A layout where the position of the childrens can be described in relation to each other or to the parent.
A layout to display its children in a single order (horizontal or vertical).
A layout that allows the view hierarchy placed within it to be scrolled when the hierarchy is beyond its own bound.
A layout that arranges its childrens into rows and columns.
A layout that places its childrens in rectangular grid.
A layout that manages interactions between its children.

Android is a mobile operating system (OS) currently developed by Google, based on the Linux kernel and designed primarily for touchscreen mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets. 

Android was initially authored by Android, Inc., which Google bought in 2005,[17] and unveiled it in 2007, along with the founding of the Open Handset Alliance – a consortium of hardware, software, and telecommunication companies devoted to advancing open standards for mobile devices. 

Android's source code is released by Google under open source licenses, although most Android devices ultimately ship with both open source and proprietary software, including required proprietary components for Google's services.
A layout that hides content out of the screen.
Bottom sheets slide up from the bottom of the screen to reveal more content.
Bottom sheet is a Material component which added to the Android Support Library in v23.2.0. It slide up from the bottom of the screen to reveal more content.
There are two types of bottom sheets:
• Persistent bottom sheet (Views that come up from the bottom of the screen)

BottomSheetBehavior is applied to a child\'s layout_behavior xml attribute of CoordinatorLayout. The height of the visible part of the sheet can be set with xml attribute behavior_peekHeight or Java method setPeekHeight(int) when the sheet is collapsed.

User may open/close the sheet with dragging/swiping gestures, or it can be controlled programmatically with setState(int) to one of the following 5 states:
 
	• STATE_COLLAPSED: The sheet is collapsed and only a visible part is showing if peek height has set (>1dp). 
	• STATE_EXPANDED: The sheet is visible to its maximum height. 
	• STATE_DRAGGING: The sheet is being dragged up or down. 
	• STATE_SETTLING: The sheet is settling to a specific height (peek height, expanded height or 0) after a drag/swipe gesture. 
	• STATE_HIDDEN: The sheet is no longer visible.
A horizontal layout to display tabs.
A layout that animates between two or more views.
A layout displays items in two-dimensional scrollable grid.
A layout displays a list of scrollable items vertically.
An AdapterView that displayes list of items in a stack of cards which can be swiped away towards the corner of the screen or navigate to the next by flipping these virtual cards.
A more advanced and flexible ListView/GridView designed for displaying large data sets efficiently.

A simple, unobtrusive message in a small popup near the bottom of the screen, centered horizontally by default. Usually used in a response to an action or operation a user has performed and automatically disappear after a timeout.
Provide brief feedback that contain very short text and a single text action at the bottom of the screen.

A dialog is a small window that prompts user to make a decision, selection, or enter additional information. Normally used for modal events that require users to take an action before they can proceed.
A dialog with pre-defined UI that allows user to select a date or time.
An user interface element that display outside an app to indicate an event has occurred which user can view and respond to it by dragging down the status bar to open the notification drawer.
Demonstrate the usage of View animation and Drawable animation.
Demonstrate the usage of Property animation.
I am new to Android Development

This training is designed primarily for Software Developers, Software Engineers and other IT professionals who are interested to learn to get start on building Android apps incorporating with most of the key aspects of the platform using the official integrated development environment (IDE) with latest Android software development kit (SDK).
\n\nParticipants who have completed this training may consider to advance their learning by attending the Post Android Development training. Subjects offered from both training cover most exam content required to sit for the Associate Android Developer certification.
I am ready for Post Android Development

This training is designed primarily for entry-level Android developer who are intended to advance their knowledge to improve the quality and better optimize on the development of their applications on Android platforms.
\n\nBy completing this training and equal with the fundamental knowledge of building Android apps incorporating with most of the key aspects of the platform, participants are ready to sit for the Associate Android Developer certification.
Demonstrate the usage of ViewPropertyAnimator to fade in/out and translate a TextView.
Demonstrate the various effects of interpolator via View animation.
A component that perform long-running operations / remote processes in the background.
A component that responds to system-wide broadcast announcements.
A component that manages a shared set of application data.

A View that displays online content (e.g. web pages) within an Activity with the *WebKit rendering engine. 

* Since Android 4.4 (KitKat), it is based on the Chromium open source project and share the same rendering engine as Chrome for Android. 
** In Android 5.0 (Lollipop), the WebView has moved to an APK (Settings > Apps > Android System WebView) so it can be updated separately to the Android platform. 
***In Android 7.0 (Nougat), Chrome APK (v51 and above) is used to provide and render Android System WebView.
A framework designed to be enabled proper and easy work around with the UI thread.

UI thread is in-charged of dispatching events to the user interface and interacts with components from Android UI Toolkit. Thus: 

1. Do not block it.
2. Do not update UI from outside UI Thread.
A structured set of data held in device.
Interface associated with an Activity or Fragment for managing one or more Loader instances, a class that performs asynchronous loading of data.
Sensor(s) is not available in your device.
